question: Which of the following is / are correct statement(s) about Gypsum?
option1: It’s a mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate
option3: It is commonly added to saline soils to reduce salinity
explanation: Gypsum is a mineral composed of calcium sulfate dihydrate. It’s a soft mineral and colorless to white in color. It is commonly added to saline soils to reduce salinity and also used in wallboard (drywall) and plaster of paris.
